net.cloud.server.game.action

Class ButtonAction

  • java.lang.Object
    • net.cloud.server.game.action.ButtonAction
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    Action

    public abstract class ButtonAction
extends Object
implements Action
    A ButtonAction is the abstraction for an action the server takes when a button was pressed by a client. Tied to a ButtonActionID. A ButtonAction knows how to decode the buffered arguments sent to it, as there may or may not be any, and their format is up to the action to decide. (non-uniform) A ButtonAction also knows how to handle itself, of course.

    • Method Detail

      • getActionID

        public ButtonActionID getActionID()
        Obtain a ButtonActionID, which allows access to button-related information. Apparently, I can restrict the return type and still obey the interface. So that's cool.
        Specified by:
        getActionID in interface Action
        Returns:
        The ID of the action

      • decodeArgs

        public void decodeArgs(Bufferable[] args,
                       io.netty.buffer.ByteBuf data)
                throws BufferableException
        Decode arguments that the button may need. The array should be initialized, and the needed data should be in the buffer starting at the current reader index. This will then read the data and place the decoded information in the array so that handle(...) may use it later. The default implementation of this method does nothing.
        Parameters:
        args - Initialized array of context arguments
        data - Buffer containing raw data which will become the decoded arguments
        Throws:
        BufferableException - If one arose during decoding

      • handle

        public abstract void handle(Player player,
                            Bufferable[] args)
                     throws Exception
        Handle the button action. Take care of whatever action the button needs to, using the provided Player and arguments. The arguments will have been decoded by decodeArgs(...) prior to this method being called.
        Parameters:
        player - The player that pressed a button, starting this whole chain of events
        args - Arguments that the client wanted to send to the action
        Throws:
        Exception - If something went wrong while handling the action
